intro: Werdermannia anethifolia, commonly known as the anise-leaved wormwood, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, anise-scented leaves that give it a distinctive aromatic quality. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its medicinal properties have been explored in traditional herbal practices for its potential health benefits.
